programme.title: DRAUGU SPĒLES
programme.desc: Seši draugi, kas viens otru pazīst teju vai visu mūžu, no jauna apvienojušies, lai izspēlētu čomu spēles. Tās ir trakotas sacensības ar absurdiem fiziskiem un mentāliem izaicinājumiem. Kad visi groži ir parauti vaļā, apņēmības pilnie draugi savstarpēji cīnās, grābj un iesaistās trakotās ballītēs, lai vinnētu 150 tūkstošus ASV dolāru.

programme.title: Atrakciju parks
programme.desc: Reiz bija vienkāršāki laiki – un šajos laikos dziļi Amerikas nekurienē bija atrakciju parks “Action Point”, kur ik nobrauciens beidzās ar brīvo kritienu, un neviens par tādiem niekiem nesūdzējās. Taču konkurenti nesnauž. Kad pilsētiņā tiek atvērts moderns un visām drošības prasībām atbilstošs atrakciju parks, sākas sīva cīņa par apmeklētājiem. Lai “Action Point” atgūtu popularitāti, tās īpašnieks izvēlas ļoti apšaubāmu stratēģiju.

programme.title: Aukstasinīga atriebība
programme.desc: Pēc iespējas tālāk no civilizācijas – tāds bija Henrija mērķis, kad viņš par savām mājām izvēlējās mājiņu pie nomaļa kalnu ezera Ziemeļamerikā. Henrijs cenšas atstāt aiz muguras savu pagātni kā algots slepkava, taču kādu dienu viņa miers tiek iztraucēts. Viņš atrod smagi ievainoto Melodiju, kura ar sniega motociklu cietusi avārijā. Henrijs palīdz jaunajai sievietei atgūt veselību, taču uzstāj, ka viņai drīz jādodas prom. Šķiet, ka Melodija glabā daudzus noslēpumus. Bijušais slepkava drīz saprot, ka tā nav tikai policija, kas dzen pēdas Melodijai.

programme.title: Pasaules smieklīgāko video kuriozu top 10 3
programme.desc: Ik dienu pasaulē notiek negaidīti, pārsteidzoši, neveikli un smieklīgi gadījumi – īsti kuriozi. Labi, ja tādos brīžos pa rokai gadījusies videokamera, un šie jautrie gadījumi ir iemūžināti. Raidījums apkopojis smieklīgākos video kuriozus no visas pasaules.

programme.title: Pārkāpumi sportā
programme.desc: Ieskats profesionālā sporta sarežģītajā pasaulē. Intervijas, arhīvu materiāli un pētnieciski ziņojumi atklās skandālu, sāncensības un slavas psiholoģisko ietekmi uz sportistiem un komandām.

programme.title: Patagonija. Dzīve pasaules malā
programme.desc: Patagonija – viena no unikālākajām vietām uz Zemes, kur augsne ir neauglīga, bet jūra ir dzīvības bagāta. Izmantojot zemūdens kameras, helikopterus, dronus un GoPro kameras, vesela gada garumā filmēšanas komanda iemūžinājusi unikālus kadrus ar retiem dzīvniekiem, kādus nereti nav iespējams sastapt nekur citur. Dokumentālās filmu sērijas veidotāji stājās pretī ekstremāliem laikapstākļiem, izsalkušiem plēsējiem, vētrainām jūrām, stāviem kalniem un saules svelmei, lai atklātu mežonīgās un nepieradināmās Patagonijas dabas dārgumus.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: The Nazis went to great lengths to warp the natural world to their whims as they believed that ruins that could prove the Aryans to be the superior race lay buried in the soil.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: D-Day: The Soldiers Story
programme.sub-title: Giles Milton visits key D-Day sites along the Normandy coastline - including Omaha Beach and Pegasus Bridge - and we hear the stories of the men and women on both the attacking and defensive lines.
programme.desc: A two-part documentary that tells the story of D-Day - June the 6th, 1944 like its never been told before as presenter Giles Milton reveals an astonishing tale of fear, courage and heroism.

programme.title: Conquistadors: The Rise and Fall
programme.sub-title: The ruthlessly ambitious Hernán Cortes travels deep into the Mexican interior to conquer the Aztecs, one of the greatest empires in the Americas.
programme.desc: Popular culture has painted the Conquistadors as brave Christian pioneers, but a shifting narrative has revealed a darker story to their rise and fall.

programme.title: Normandy: Land of Warriors
programme.sub-title: Philip Augustus, the king of France, has one objective: to conquer the Normandy of Duke Richard the Lionheart. John Lackland, the Duke of Normandys own brother, and Philip unite against Richard.
programme.desc: From the Viking invasions to the great sieges of Richard the Lionheart, the history of the Dukes of Normandy is an incredible military epic spanning more than 300 years.

programme.title: Mesopotamia Rediscovered
programme.desc: A new generation of archaeologists reopens the mythical Mesopotamian sites of Nineveh, Lagash and Larsa; using new technologies, they make astounding discoveries in the very first cities built by man.

programme.title: Iznik, The Sunken Enigma
programme.desc: We follow a world-renowned team excavating the sunken remains of a 4th-century A.D. / C.E. Byzantine basilica in Lake Iznik in Turkey; how and why was it destroyed, and what happened to its community?

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: On a hill near Mt. Ararat in Turkey is what most scientists believe is just an unusually shaped rock formation; hoping to prove its the remains of Noahs Ark, a research team investigates the site.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The story of how Persia morphed into Iran is very much the story of one family, the Pahlavis. Their reign would prove short-lived for a dynasty, but it was the most tumultuous in the nations history.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: Archaeologists discovery of King Tuts tomb taught us about a lost civilisation. When death befell several members of the team, rumours of a curse on the tomb spread like wildfire around the world.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: On a hill near Mt. Ararat in Turkey is what most scientists believe is just an unusually shaped rock formation; hoping to prove its the remains of Noahs Ark, a research team investigates the site.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Mesopotamia Rediscovered
programme.desc: A new generation of archaeologists reopens the mythical Mesopotamian sites of Nineveh, Lagash and Larsa; using new technologies, they make astounding discoveries in the very first cities built by man.

programme.title: Iznik, The Sunken Enigma
programme.desc: We follow a world-renowned team excavating the sunken remains of a 4th-century A.D. / C.E. Byzantine basilica in Lake Iznik in Turkey; how and why was it destroyed, and what happened to its community?

programme.title: The Lost World of the Hanging Gardens
programme.desc: This documentary is a rediscovery of Nineveh, capital of one of the greatest civilisations - the worlds first genuine superpower, the Assyrians. Why did this great city disappear?

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: WWII was a war in the skies; though the Treaty of Versailles had prevented the Germans from developing new weapons, they sponsored air clubs and pushed for supremacy in the air.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: Adolf Hitler was famously against using chemical and biological weapons, but chemistry and biological science still played an incredible role in the Nazis unquenchable quest for power.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: What would it take to bomb the Allies into the ground? This was the question on the minds of top Nazi brass as they mobilised Germanys top scientists to create frightening new bombs.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: Science was a tool to help the war effort for the Nazis; how could a Nazi soldier and its leadership be optimised, and what secret Nazi plans can we glean from a hidden crypt in Thuringia?
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: The Nazis built a number of radar stations and systems harnessing the power of frequencies to help them plot their next move; were they also harnessing the power of the Sun itself?
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: Japanese troops occupy Southern Vietnam and Cambodia, but the day that changes the war comes on December 7th when Japanese aircraft attack the American Pacific Fleet at anchor in Pearl Harbor.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: Japans escalation of the War in the East is devastatingly effective, but despite their success it is possible to see their inevitable defeat, and they have roused the military might of the USA.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The war turns in favour of the Allies. Montgomery turns the tables on the Afrika Corps at El Alamein, the Japanese are defeated at Guadalcanal and the Germans are defeated at Stalingrad.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The Allied leaders meet for their first conference to discuss the coordination of their efforts, a Japanese Division is destroyed at sea, and the Red Army begins its advance towards Berlin.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The Germans continue their retreat from Russia, but the most significant event at this stage of the war is the second front in Europe with the D-Day landings on June 6th - Operation Overlord.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: The Masters of the Reich
programme.sub-title: Decoding tools reveal exchanges between the Fuhrer and his allies; Hitler morphs from political leader to military strategist; the masters of the Reich unleash a world war in seven years.
programme.desc: This series sheds a new light on the Second World War by revealing what the masters of the Reich and their acolytes were really saying to each other while being filmed thinking no-one could hear them.

programme.title: WWII: Endgame
programme.sub-title: The early years of WWII caused devastation throughout Europe; the 1939 non-aggression pact between the Germans and Russians had promised safety for the Soviet Union, but Hitler was not to be trusted.
programme.desc: This is the story of the Grand Alliance of WWII, the unlikely team of Great Britain, the Soviet Union and the US that came together to defeat Hitler before fracturing and turning on itself.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Zahi Hawass is excavating an enclosure called Gisr El-Mudir where sarcophagi containing mysterious mummies and rich painted tombs are discovered; will these treasures lead them to Imhotep?
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: WWII: Endgame
programme.sub-title: The early years of WWII caused devastation throughout Europe; the 1939 non-aggression pact between the Germans and Russians had promised safety for the Soviet Union, but Hitler was not to be trusted.
programme.desc: This is the story of the Grand Alliance of WWII, the unlikely team of Great Britain, the Soviet Union and the US that came together to defeat Hitler before fracturing and turning on itself.

programme.desc: This series sheds a new light on the Second World War by revealing what the masters of the Reich and their acolytes were really saying to each other while being filmed thinking no-one could hear them.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: The Nazis went to great lengths to warp the natural world to their whims as they believed that ruins that could prove the Aryans to be the superior race lay buried in the soil.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Conquistadors: The Rise and Fall
programme.sub-title: The ruthlessly ambitious Hernán Cortes travels deep into the Mexican interior to conquer the Aztecs, one of the greatest empires in the Americas.
programme.desc: Popular culture has painted the Conquistadors as brave Christian pioneers, but a shifting narrative has revealed a darker story to their rise and fall.

programme.title: Normandy: Land of Warriors
programme.sub-title: Philip Augustus, the king of France, has one objective: to conquer the Normandy of Duke Richard the Lionheart. John Lackland, the Duke of Normandys own brother, and Philip unite against Richard.
programme.desc: From the Viking invasions to the great sieges of Richard the Lionheart, the history of the Dukes of Normandy is an incredible military epic spanning more than 300 years.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Were they actually created by ancient people, or did they have extra-terrestrial origins? The Wests museums were taken in until it emerged that an antique dealer had them made in the 19th century.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Apparently imprinted with an image of Jesus crucified body, the Turin Shroud is one of Christianitys most famous holy relics; scientists battle to try to prove if its genuine or a fake.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.desc: This is the story of the Grand Alliance of WWII, the unlikely team of Great Britain, the Soviet Union and the US that came together to defeat Hitler before fracturing and turning on itself.

programme.title: Mesopotamia Rediscovered
programme.desc: A new generation of archaeologists reopens the mythical Mesopotamian sites of Nineveh, Lagash and Larsa; using new technologies, they make astounding discoveries in the very first cities built by man.

programme.title: The Lost World of the Hanging Gardens
programme.desc: This documentary is a rediscovery of Nineveh, capital of one of the greatest civilisations - the worlds first genuine superpower, the Assyrians. Why did this great city disappear?

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: The Mayan city of Chichen Itza was the capital of a powerful civilisation - the water wizards of the Itzas - but was mysteriously abandoned between the 11th and 13th centuries.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: Commonly known as Notre Dame, Notre Dame de Paris Cathedral is one of the most emblematic monuments of Paris and France; its construction began in 1163 and lasted for two centuries.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.sub-title: The Great Pyramids stand as a testament to Egypts power, but the Old Kingdom collapsed by 2200 B.C. / B.C.E; what caused the fall of the Pyramid Age?
programme.desc: Why do civilisations collapse? Follow archaeologists as they examine ruins across the world and uncover the reasons why some of historys greatest civilisations vanished.

programme.title: The Pharaohs: Greater Than The Pyramids
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra VII, the last queen of ancient Egypt, embodied the fall of Egypt to Rome; this episode explores the truth behind her death, one that has sparked debate among historians.
programme.desc: Djoser, Khufu, Ramses II, Ramses III, Alexander the Great and Cleopatra - this series explores the life and reign of these pharaohs while illuminating their relationship with other Pharaonic figures.

programme.title: The Pharaohs: Greater Than The Pyramids
programme.sub-title: A pharaoh of the 20th dynasty, Ramses IIIs reign was marked by internal conspiracies and a tragic end that symbolised the end of the golden age of Pharaonic Egypt.
programme.desc: Djoser, Khufu, Ramses II, Ramses III, Alexander the Great and Cleopatra - this series explores the life and reign of these pharaohs while illuminating their relationship with other Pharaonic figures.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: The scars of centuries of conflict are etched into Italys ancient landmarks; this episode explores how it rose from the devastating failure of fascism to the rebirth of its identity.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: France faced a tumultuous journey during and after WWII; this episode captures Frances struggle, resilience and rebirth and shows how architecture became a powerful symbol of recovery and renewal.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: Amidst the smouldering ruins of WWII, Japan faced devastation unlike any the world had ever seen; the nation rebuilt itself to become a beacon of modern ingenuity, resilience, and remembrance.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: The Lost Scrolls of Vesuvius
programme.desc: We reveal the ground-breaking science being used by Professor Brent Seales as he attempts to be the first person in nearly 2,000 years to read inside the ancient scrolls found in Herculaneum.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass hopes to discover the tomb of Imhotep, the architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser, and aims to unearth the many secrets of the Egyptian mummies with his team.
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: In 1946, Hermann Goering cheated the hangman by deciding his own fate; how did he manage to get hold of a cyanide capsule in a maximum-security prison? We explore the theories surrounding his death.
programme.desc: A look at some of the most shocking Nazi murder cases. Incorporating expert interviews and dramatic reconstruction, each episode tells another side to a time in history that you thought you knew.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: June-July 1944: three weeks after D-Day, the Allied advance has stalled; the killing fields around Hill 112 become the start of a brutal war of attrition that the Nazis cannot afford to wage.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The Allies continue their eastward push from Normandy and close on the German border; in the east, the Soviet Union unleashes Operation Bagration, the greatest offensive of the war.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: WWII: Endgame
programme.sub-title: Nazi Germanys fate was all but sealed by late 1944, but Hitlers manic denial of this impending defeat would lead to his final gamble at the Battle of the Bulge.
programme.desc: This is the story of the Grand Alliance of WWII, the unlikely team of Great Britain, the Soviet Union and the US that came together to defeat Hitler before fracturing and turning on itself.

programme.title: Working for the Enemy
programme.sub-title: 13 million forced labourers toil for the Nazis; it is rare that these young people experience kindness or love as the Germans are strictly prohibited from having any personal interaction with them.
programme.desc: The fate of more than 13 million Europeans was entirely overlooked in the aftermath of WWII: that of the children and young adults taken from their homes and forced to work for the enemy.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: The Sphinx is the most monumental ancient sculpture in the world at 73 metres long, 20 metres high and 14 metres wide. Who commissioned it, how was it erected, and what is its significance?
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.
